author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
<@425572898787426305> We ( <@554799849288105986> and I) discussed about https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/specification.md#specification-1 today.
The spec says:
- if shanghai && withdrawals == nil -> return INVALID
- if !shanghai && withdrawals != nil -> return INVALID

There are two cases missing
- if shanghai && withdrawals != nil -> return valid (intuitive)
- if !shanghai && withdrawals == nil -> return ?
 I interpreted that as we should return INVALID then, but everyone else seems to agree that we should return valid (and I agree). I think it should be made more clear in the spec that this method can be called before the fork with non-withdrawal blocks

author: ethdreamer
content:
The spec only enumerates cases that require invalid. If a block makes it through all the invalidation conditions, it is valid. You wouldn't also enumerate all valid cases. Also withdrawals wouldn't be nullible if there wasn't a valid case where it is null.

That's how I interpret it anyway

author: potuz
content: The spec as it is today is clear and precise in regards to that issue IMO
